revised_title: The Influence of Carbonic Anhydride and Other Gases on Micro-Organism Development
tldr: The authors conducted experiments to study the effects of various gases on the development of microorganisms, including Bacillus pyocyaneus, Koch's Comma Spirillum, and Finkler's Comma Spirillum. They found that carbonic anhydride had the most destructive influence on the microorganisms, while hydrogen had the least impact. The results suggest that microorganisms may reach their maximum activity when the gaseous products they produce are removed by an indifferent gas like hydrogen.
